title: Renamed Department of Defense to 'Department of War'
summary: September 4, 2025: Trump signed executive order renaming Department of Defense to 'Department of War' as 'secondary title.' Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth authorized to use 'Secretary of War' title. DoD website changed to War.gov. Bronze 'Department of War' plaques installed at Pentagon entrances. Congressional Budget Office: rebranding costs $10-125 million taxpayer dollars, 'hundreds of millions' if legally changed. Only Congress can legally rename federal departments. Harry Truman unified military under 'Defense' name in 1949 to move away from militaristic 'War Department' (founded 1789). Critics called move authoritarian branding reverting to pre-1949 militarism.
